text: Pedro González López (born 25 November 2002), commonly known as Pedri, is a Spanish professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for Barcelona. ==Club career== ===Las Palmas=== Born in Tegueste, Tenerife, Canary Islands, Pedri joined UD Las Palmas's youth setup in 2018 from CF Juventud Laguna. On 15 July 2019, aged only 16, he signed a professional four-year contract with the club, being promoted to the first team by manager Pepe Mel. Pedri made his professional debut on 18 August 2019, aged only 16, by starting in a 0–1 home loss against SD Huesca for the Segunda División championship. He scored his first professional goal on 19 September, netting the game's only in a home success over Sporting de Gijón and became the youngest goalscorer in Las Palmas history at 16 years, 9 months and 23 days of age. ===Barcelona=== On 2 September 2019, FC Barcelona reached an agreement with Las Palmas for the transfer of Pedri, effective as of the following 1 July 2020. The player agreed to a two-year contract with the Catalans, who paid €5 million for the deal. Assigned to the main squad for the 2020–21 season and with the number 16 jersey, Pedri made his Barça – and La Liga – debut on 27 September, replacing Philippe Coutinho in a 4–0 home routing of Villarreal CF. He was handed his first start on 17 October, in a 0–1 away loss against Getafe CF.
